Edited by Daniele Filippi

On January 1st, 1594 Marenzio signed the dedication of his Sesto libro de madrigali a cinque voci to Cinzio Aldobrandini Passeri (1551–1610), nephew of Pope Clement VIII and recently appointed cardinal. Aldobrandini was a distinguished patron of artists and poets, famously of Torquato Tasso; Battista Guarini, G. Bardi and Angelo Grillo, among others, were part of his patronage network. The dedication, entirely constructed from genre-specific topoi and cliché, does not shed any further light on the circumstances of the composition and of the arrangement for publication.
